title: How to find a website to download free books - Quora

response.answer_text: Visit Kindle Book Store. Locate those books which are prized at $0. You need a Kindle software to read such books. It is available free of cost for all types of devices. If interested then visit the following link for the software. https://www.amazon.com/kindle-dbs/fd/kcp For acquiring some of the books already collected in a post then visit the following link: Free Classic Novels of Munshi Premchand (HINDI) For more free books explore the following blog: Thus, I Read a Book Another source is Hourly History. They send two books free of cost every Friday which remains free for three days for download. For reading their books you need Kindle software. A way out is suggested above. The link for the Hourly History is given below. You provide them your email. There are not obligation of any kind. They are tried links. The link is as follows: http://clicks.aweber.com/y/ct/?l=LMHyf&m=3W8VB.gBET5NbfM&b=5k_.teBnixrfd8Dy4vP6Pg Another way is explore for books on Google Books and Amazon.com for such books which are available free of cost. Another way is to check the digital Library of India. You can use books.google.com. Check for an author who belongs to earlier part of twentieth century or older one. When the results are displayed, check the tool option which can be easily located on the right hand side above the search result. Click the tool and then check free books. You will be surprised to learn the result. Similarly one can check Digital Library of Free Books, Movies, Music & Wayback Machine with your query and interest. There are books covering every conceivable subject. Same is true for Google books. Another way is to try to check your query in search engine with pdf attached to it. You may find numerous such sites. All check sumir-history.blogspot.in. In the label section locate the classic libraries and digital library. There are many books available on such sites. One of the popular site is sacred-texts.com. You may find numerous books there. Then check the following site of journalist. http://www.holybooks.com/wp-content/uploads/Autobiography-of-a-Yogi-by-Paramahansa-Yogananda.pdf The site is www.holybooks.com. You may explore it for a year to collect the free books.

Your local public library.Project GutenbergBookbub, or Instafreebie, or any of the sites that authors and publishers use to market their books. (You’ll be expected to review it, but it’s not a contractual requirement.)What you don’t really want to do is to pirate it. That hurts the people (and they’re almost always poor) who write and create the books you want to read. Sooner or later, they’ll have to stop doing that work, if people pirate regularly. That’s a very short-sighted approach.

You should definitely check out MyPustak to get free books. They have a huge library with lots of different genres for readers of every age. As a student, I personally recommend it to buy used books. I have using it for quite a time now and I am completely satisfied with the service.
Project Gutenberg is free. They only have things whose copyright has expired or was given to them for distribution. They have a lot of classics and popular texts from every genre.
I suggest you enter the phrase “Downloadable Free Books” in the Quora Search bar.
Hmm im not quite sure, but maybe try just typing in free online books into the search engine. This website looks pretty good: https://www.free-ebooks.net/

There are many free books available on many popular downloadable apps. Just download the app, search for free books, download the book. And you will have said book in the app cloud library, to open and read at leisure.
Here is a very popular thread on Quora about this with tons of recommendations: What is a good website for free books?
